intro: Belantheria belvisiana, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces showy, violet-blue blossoms that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
